{"step_by_step_thinking": "Wormian bones are small, extra bone pieces that occur within a suture in the cranium. These are often seen in people with certain diseases or disorders, such as osteogenesis imperfecta, or Down syndrome. They are not typically associated with trauma or abuse. On the other hand, microfractures in the sub-epiphyseal region, corner fractures, and bucket handle fractures of metaphyses are all types of injuries that can be suggestive of non-accidental trauma or child abuse.", "answer_choice": "A"}
